name: code-reviewer
description: MCP specification for code review agents. Accepts a PR ID and returns structured review comments.

tools.name: review_pr
tools.description: Performs a code review on the specified pull request and returns structured comments.

focus.description: Optional list of aspects to focus the review on. Defaults to all.

tools.name: get_review_status
tools.description: Returns the current review status and existing comments for a PR.

resources.name: PR Review Comments
resources.description: All review comments posted on a given pull request.

resources.name: PR Diff
resources.description: The raw unified diff of the pull request for context.

prompts.name: code_review
prompts.description: Standard code review prompt. Instructs the agent to analyse the PR diff and produce structured, actionable feedback.

arguments.name: language
arguments.description: Primary programming language of the PR (e.g. 'Solidity', 'TypeScript')

arguments.name: focus
arguments.description: Comma-separated list of review aspects: bugs, security, style, performance, tests, documentation

prompts.template:
You are a senior {{#if language}}{{language}} {{/if}}code reviewer.

Review pull request {{pr_id}}.

{{#if focus}}Focus specifically on: {{focus}}.{{else}}Cover all aspects: bugs, security, style, performance, tests and documentation.{{/if}}

For every issue found, provide:
- The file name and line number
- Severity: info | warning | error | critical
- Category: bugs | security | style | performance | tests | documentation
- A clear message explaining the problem
- A concrete suggestion for how to fix it

Finish with a one-paragraph summary and a recommendation: APPROVE or REQUEST_CHANGES.
